answers.answer: Give me a shout Dac. I have been on it for 6 months now and doing very well. If you have any questions - just reach out!!Love ya !!
Keep us posted ........ always great to hear from you.  I really hope this med does the trick for you!!!!C~

So I've been on the Armour now for almost a week and the one big difference is the amount of swelling.  It has gone down drastically.  My mom even said tonight that my face was starting to look like me again.  It has stayed so swollen that you could say I've been moon faced.  Just like if I'd been on steroids.  Even my nose is getting back to normal!  YEAH!!!  My hands, feet, and stomach have gone down a lot also.Also seems that my diabetes meds are working better.  Something is b/c I haven't changed anything but my glucose levels are coming down.Am so excited about all this!!Go to the dr Friday to have thyroid labs done and am going to have him run all of them.  This may just be the best answer for me I've found in years.Dac
Wow, sounds like you are doing great on Armour.  May I ask?  What were you on before?  What made you decide to change?  Are you only taking Armour now?
DAc - good news finally for you!!I would definate do some extra reading on Armour and see how you can benefit from the meds more the longer you take it.I hope this is the answer to your prayers.
Way to go Dac!!Good for you! hope you feel better and better. :-)
I've been on Levothyroxine for years.  At this point I don't think i will ever go back on it again.  Things seem to be improving for me almost daily now.Thanks all!!
Gee Dac- great news. Recently I am digging really deep in learning more about Armour and boy when the time is right _ I really got more information for you.
Any time now, Stella.  I'm ready.

question: Got my first bottle of Armour today and will start it in the morning.  Am excited hoping this is really going to make a difference.  Will have to let you all know in a couple of days.  Most ppl say they notice a difference that quickly.  Am praying hard.Dac
title: Great Hope for Armour Thyroid
